Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GrimReefer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a total of 5 nights. The first 2 nights we had a room on the 1st floor which was not nice. It was loud from the street below and the walls were paper thin!! We could hear the people in the next room talking and watching tv. We left the hotel for an overnight stay in Naples and on our final 3 nights we were on the 5th floor. This was a great stay. The room was great, the walls appeared to have better insulation from the noise of other rooms and being heighet the noise from thr street was no problem. The breakfast was great, plenty of choice for all tastes! Overall our stay was great. The closeness to the main strain station and metro was great and it is within easy walking distance to most of the sights. We would stay again, it is great value for money and a great position.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Right Next To Termini.”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Edit
Reviews.Content: Made a last minute booking and were pleased with our choice. Only a 5 minute walk from the Termini and hence the metro station if you chose to use it. The room itself was of a good standard and the bathroom was excellent. Slightly disappointed with the service and attention from the concierge and reception staff. They seemed rather uninterested to help and you almost had to wave at them to get their attention. The electrics blew in the room (dodgy tv socket connection), but this was fixed after an hour or so.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine; location is terrible”
Reviews.Author: artprof13
Reviews.Content: It was hard to decide whether to give an average or poor rating to this property. But really, its problems are not of the hotel, but from the neighborhood. It is basically a stone's throw from the main train station, a notoriously terrible part of town (I was booked as part of a group, so had no choice). But - the actually hotel was quite pleasant. Comfortable room, nice lobby and breakfast, good internet service. The only complaint was that the keys to the doors didn't work very well - it was always a battle to get in the room and it seemed that the cleaning staff never actually pulled the door shut enough to lock it. If the hotel was in a different part of town, I'd recommend it - but basically I'd just never say to stay in that area even for the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: sunnybombay
Reviews.Content: Very near to termini the main train stattion and walking distance from colloseo. if for business very convenient and easy to cabs etc. Great view from the terrace .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Classic Italian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CraigSunney
Reviews.Content: Some of the other reviews have mentioned 'old dated decor' and the location being noisy with the windows open. Fact No 1. Rome is Noisy. If you want to be in the center and sleep with the window open, do not be surprised if you can hear life pulsing under the building. This hotel is 2 minutes from Termini train station, with every sidewalk having a ramp down and ramp up until you get into the station. It is 20 mins walk from the Colosseum and about the same to the Trevi fountain. So conveniently located in 'central Rome' is a good description. If you want peace and quiet. Go to the countryside of Umbria or Tuscany. Then about decor. Like the other hotels owned by this family, (Mediterraneo/Atlantico etc opposite), it is done in the Art Deco style. Hotels only began to be created at the end of the 18th century beginning of the 19th century in Italy. Before this, people on the 'Grand Tour' were mostly nobles, who stayed with friends or family in Italy in Villas and Palaces. There is a guide book in Italian that has a list of all 'historic' locations that are over 100 years old. For example, the Cafe Greco is in it. This hotel is in it too. Having said that, this well maintained, service is excellent. High thread count sheets. 'Standard' buffet breakfast. I look forward to going back. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and location”
Reviews.Author: TommyOde
Reviews.Content: The service was freindly and prompt. We requested two connecting rooms and got it. Breakfast was ok, but the dining room was very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Breakfast and Location!”
Reviews.Author: SuePicco
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a ten day stay at the Hotel Massimo D'Azeglio. We had a great room. Although a little noisy with the windows open, it was very quiet with the shutters closed. The hotel was close to Termini, the Green Line Tours and we could walk to S Maria Maggiore. It was extremely easy to catch the Leonardo Line from Fumicino Airport and saved time and money. Breakfast was outstanding and catered both to Italians and Americans. We'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation and restaurant - front desk needs a shakeup”
Reviews.Author: JohnSSydney
Reviews.Content: Accommodation here was very good especially if you can get one of the larger rooms that face the courtyard where the street noise is none existent. On a negative note, their front desk seems to be very disorganised and dismissive. If you are wanting to book an airport shuttle with the front desk be doubly sure they have it and then check again on the day you are leaving because they seem to have a some sort of hand written diary system that is the most scrappy and useless system I have seen. Breakfasts here are quite substandard and the breakfast room is very small and overcrowded for a hotel like this. On the other hand their dining room for evening meals is very spacious and the food and service is very good. We would eat at that restaurant again. It is in a great central location with a lot of little restaurants and the open top bus station all close by. Finally the wi-fi in the room is not great.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: janefromtexas
Reviews.Content: The room overlooking a courtyard and the full bath were comfortable. Since this was not our first trip to Rome, we were interested in other than the usual sites, and the hotel was well located. It was also easy for cab drivers to find the hotel when referenced by Termini. Breakfast buffet was a bit crowded and the food "ok" Bar drinks including Cokes were pricey. The staff was helpful, but not overly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near Roma Termini”
Reviews.Author: graphicsights
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September '11 and we were not dissapointed all things considered. The reason I say that is because we are 4-star travellers but the hotel shows more like a 3 star +. The location was excellent if you want to avoid costly taxis; 10 minute walk from Roma Termini station. 30-45 minute power walk to Trevi Fountain. 15 minute walk to the Colloseum. The front desk was very nice and helpful and provided us with anything we asked for. The room we have (Superior) was very large as well as the bathroom. The rooms were cleaned and security was never an issue (in-room safe provided FOC). WiFi was also included throughout our stay. The only 2complaints I have about the hotel are 1. that the hallways stink of cigarette smoke. When I say stink I mean a strong soaked in stench. They need to implement (and enforce) a no smoking policy in this hotel or limit it to certain floors. Lastly, the included breakfast wasn't great. The eggs were always VERY cold and strange looking. The rest of the selection (breads and fruit) were ok but I need eggs with my breaky. All in all, compared to the prices in the rest of Rome, you probably can't overlook this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location !”
Reviews.Author: trinitravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2011 and were really pleased with our room - a superior double. It was huge with a view of a quiet courtyard, so you never knew that you were only a block from the Central station. Really well connected for sightseeing, and several restaurants and cafes in the immediate area. The breakfast buffet was extensive, although the breakfast room could get quite crowded in the morning. Staff were all helpful and friendly, and we had no complaints about the standard of cleanliness in the room. We would recommend this hotel for both its quality and the convenience of the location, and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “solid hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: ronetc
Reviews.Content: One of the dozens of hotels on Via Cavour, near train station and Colisseum. Nice enough for a couple night's stay. Clean and comfortable rooms (wooden floors pretty but slippery). Excellent breakfast buffet, good restaurant for one night's dinner. Helpful front desk. I would rate it a nice 3-star instead of the proffered 4-star . . . but it was just fine for the beginning of a two-week trip around Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, just that!”
Reviews.Author: guklein
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel throught Priceline (give your own price). We were worried about location. As we arrived by train from Firenze and our next destination would be Fiumicino Airport, the good point it is very close to Rome Termini (train station and subway). But it is not so close to the main sights of Rome. The room is good, clean, spacious, but it was very hot. We complained with the manager and we were told that the hotel didn't have air conditioning but "fresh air". He suggested to move us to another room but after we tried it the problem was the same. Then after almost a day complaining about that problem and keeping the windows opened at night, they fixed the problem. If I would stay there again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Father, son and holy spirit...”
Reviews.Author: Fisutrip
Reviews.Content: We came to the Eternal City to spend quality time with my father. This hotel was basic set and ok, close to the Terministation. Stuff were a little disinterested, perhaps we were too touristlook without a tie and suit. The rooms were clean and the beds of good quality, screen TV and free safety-box. We took little bigger and more expensive room and we had window to the courtyard, which was a peaceful. Breakfast was average and the coffee was terrible tobacco water, as my father said; a real wash water from the dead body, Aargh!!! The hotel is a few kilometers from the old sights, but the subway and taxi is easy to go there. However, I recommend this hotel if you go to Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Rude and disrespectful staff”
Reviews.Author: Arthur_PF
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel for a six-night stay, and hotel recepcionist called "Emiliano" just told me about breakfast time, pointed to the lift and said "bye bye" (????) Yes, just like I was in a sort of slum hostel. Extremely rude and disrespectful, and they rank themselves as a four-star hotel? No way, ZERO stars. Paint smell in my room, made me sick, I'm allergic. Ruined my trip to Rome, I departed one day before. Location at Via Cavour is good. Via Cavour is a good street at Termini neighbourhood. I hated this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Even quieter rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jennypenny12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel inadvertently because our travel plans had changed while in Italy. We stayed in 4 3 different hotels in Rome, and this one was by far the best! It is very conveniently located near the bustling Termini, main train station in Rome. However, this was pleasantly the quietest hotel we ever stayed in (not just in Rome)! We could not hear our above guests moving around, and we could not hear people leaving in the morning and their doors closing. It not was only clean and quiet with adequate room, it had the best spread for breakfast. It had a self-service coffee/ cappuccino/ tea machine at your disposal. They also had some traditional hot American breakfast options (scrabbled eggs and bacon). The only downside was that the free wifi was spotty in our room. I wish we could have stayed longer! Will definitely be our #1 choice if we return to Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: racecar053
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for four days for sight-seeing tours and thus stayed at this hotel for three nights. The hotel is a short walk from the Central Termini station on Via Cavour; The location was great since it was also close to the Metro station. The hotel staff was very accomodating. There as complimentary internet access in the rooms and a computer station in the lobby (although the internet was down intermittently while we were there) Breakfast was so-so. The fitness center is actually in the sister hotel across the street. Marcello recommended a great restaurant nearby for dinner with a roofto garden-very nice! There is shopping and restaurants on Via Cavour and on Via Nazionale. Overall good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Basic for a expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: mon1987
Reviews.Content: Went to rome for a long weekend for my partners 30th birthday so i wanted a quite nice hotel and i wanted to close to the mail stations in rome. Got off the train at the termini and walked to the hotel, it only took 10 minutes, easy to find. The hotel lookes very posh when first entering, nice staff at reception. Got to room and very basic room for the 530 euro i payed for 3 nights. Bed very very uncomfty, so bad that i still have a really bad back because of this. Very noisy outside due to it been a main road. And the aircon is very noisy too, so couldnt win when we was really warm during the night, either have the noise of the main road or the noise of the aircon, (which sounded like a slightly quiter hair dryer) Cleaners are very noisy on the corridors eairly in the morning, so they wont be any lie in for you if you stay hear, the talk very loud in their own language, very very anoying, i just wanted to open the door and shout at them. The bathroom smellt really bad, i think it was the drainage, i read other reviews on this problem with the smell from the shower room and i thought to my self "how pathetic these people are" but how i was sooo wrong, the smell actually made me feel ill. Good location, but the area around this hotel was quite rough so i wouldnt advise anyone to walk round late at night, i think the latest we was out was 10pm and on our way back to the hotel we say a man gettin beat up, then the police turned up. Breakfast was very basic (only english items was bacon and scrambled egg) but the bacon and egg wasnt cooked the way we have it in england. Overall if you get this hotel at a good price then go for it, good location not too poor

Reviews.Title: “Excellect, Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Four-days-in-Rome
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Rome to race the Marathon on the 20th March with my son, we arrived on the 18th booked at reception by very helpful staff. The room and beds were Very Comfortable, All inquiries we made at the hotel regarding places we wanted to visit, they phoned ahead and passed us all the useful information, very helpful and made our trip. The hotel is fantastically placed in the Via Cavour 15 mins walk to the Colosseum, and 10 mins to the Termini Bus and Train or Metro station, The Via Cavour has some great family run restaurants. We had a splendid time. Many thanks to the Hotel and staff. Dante from Bristol

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CocoaArizona
Reviews.Content: We took a train from the airport to Termini Station which is a block away from this hotel so it is so convenient if you are traveling to places on your trip. We were pleasantly greeted and had to wait a few hours for our room because we were early. They stored our luggage and we went to the Colosseum, Forum and few other places that are a very short distance from the hotel. When we came back and went to our room it was so much more than I expected. The bathroom was huge and stocked with products, even robes! The bedroom was pleasant and they gave us a fruit basket and a coffee/tea area, which I think is rear in Italy. The breakfast had a variety of things, eggs, meats, fruit, cereal, croissants and a cappicino machine. The staff kept things full and cleaned tables quickly. The manager and the front desk people were absolutely fantastic. I think his name was Emiliamo that helped us so much especially when our phone card would not work at any phone booth. Another man waited on the phone to get us reservations to the Borghese Museum and there were 17 people ahead of him. I loved this hotel and the staff and would definitely stay there again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Splendido Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Goseetheuniverse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated on Via Cavour, 5 minutes walk from the main railway station, Termini, and within walking distance of the Coliseum and other sights. We loved our rather grand room with polished wooden floor, high ceiling and large bathroom. We really enjoyed the breakfast which catered for a wide range of tastes. We experienced excellent service. Without exception the staff were polite, professional and could not have been more helpful. I was so impressed with the hotel that I am contributing my first review on Trip Advisor

Reviews.Title: “comfort and location”
Reviews.Author: mld_portland
Reviews.Content: perfectly located 2 blocks from the main train terminal and the metro and bus system. very nice rooms and helpful staff. clean, comfortable, safe. recommend highly for your stay in Rome to see the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelNormad
Reviews.Content: Based on TA reviews chose the hotel, Very close to Termini and Metro. We had a quad room, though rooms are very dated glad that bathroom have been remodeled . Breakfast had good choices. We stayed for about three days. Nothing out of the way in terms of staff, helped when asked for. I wanted to check my email and front desk helped in allowing me to access without extra charge so that was good. Overall if you are looking for something close to station this could be your best bet

Reviews.Title: “heritage hotel near Train terminus”
Reviews.Author: SayanRoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a couple of days for a conference. It is a nice heritage hotel, 2 mins from the main train station. Looks old and feels old, but the staff are nice and friendly. The rooms clean and the food excellent. As all European breakfast it is simple but there is enough to choose from, they also have a hot breakfast like eggs. If you are on holiday, it's location would be a strong selling point as all hop-on buses start nearby or you can buy a day pass @ 4 € and travel from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected----in a good way”
Reviews.Author: tjelke
Reviews.Content: I got a room at the Bettoja Massimo on priceline- one of those name your own price deals. $120 a night. 4 star. I figured that would be fabulous. Then I got on tripadvisor and read some of the reviews and prepared myself for a less than stellar stay. No need. It was a great location, super friendly staff (including old fashioned bellhops), and our room (425) was enormous with a huge bathroom. 2 blocks from Roma Termini station and metro. The area around the hotel is a little worn, but we felt safe the whole time. They helped us get a transformer for our electric devices that weren't 220v, recommended places to eat, and even gave us advice on how to avoid congesion on the metro. Overall, I thought it was a fabulous deal and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Convenient, Would be Perfect if Staff Were Friendlier”
Reviews.Author: VirgniaBiztrvlr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in April 2010. The location is very easy to walk to, with luggage, from Termini train station. I attached a photo of the outside of the hotel as well as two photos of our room. We had a very large and comfortable room with a closet in the wall and plenty of furniture with drawers. The bathroom was very nice, with a long bathtub, a bidet, and a variety of toiletries provided. Our windows did not have a great view but since we weren't facing the street, our room was nice and quiet. It was SILENT at night, which we really appreciated!! The breakfast buffet was generous and delicious. Seating was very tight in the dining room due to how they have the tables configured. Coffee lovers will appreciate the coffee machine where you can make cappucino, espresso, etc. The staff was unfriendly. We got assistance when we asked for it, but it wasn't service with a smile and they certainly didn't go out of their way to help. There are a couple self-service laundromats very close by (with computers for accessing internet while waiting, for a tiny fee), which proved very helpful at the halfway point of our trip. It is too far to walk to the major sights, so I would suggest that you book tours that pick you up at the hotel. We did a half-day Vatican tour and a half-day Ancient Rome tour on the same day through the "Seven Hills" agency. The only major site that we had to get to on our own was The Pantheon, which we were able to find using the public bus from the nearby Termini train station. If you have time, visit the rooftop at their sister-hotel across the street during the hours that the roof restaurant is open, even if just for a drink - soak up the amazing views! (It's locked up tight during the hours that the restaurant is not open.) I want to re-state that if you are coming into and leaving Rome by train, you will find this to be an extremely convenient location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bush737
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location just a short walking distance from the Termini Train Station. Lots of restaurants and shopping around the hotel. The Colosseum is just 1 mile down the street. Multiple metro stations around the hotel. The service is great and every is nice. The room is nicely decor, but small. The bed is a little hard, but nice size. The hotel charge 10 euro to use the internet. Overall, I think the price was too high for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed”
Reviews.Author: Katano
Reviews.Content: Our locked suitcase was broken into from right inside our hotel room! In addition to invasion of privacy we lost a lot of money as well as personal identification. The hotel was not helpful in the investigation or in communicating with the police who spoke Italian which we do not understand. The manager insisted he trusts his employees and no one else could have got into the room, the truth is someone did and so far they got away with it. There are conveniently no cameras in the hallways and supposedly no tracking system for the key card entry to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Paulo_Jr
Reviews.Content: Excelent option for train travellers. Near metro and Termini (more ou less 100 meters) Clean, good breakfast. The staff pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Traveler_09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Massimo D'Azeglio for our honeymoon in mid-October 2009, and we loved it! We booked through Priceline, had read some other TripAdvisor reviews afterwards and were a bit concerned, but, it is a very nice hotel. Since it was our honeymoon, we emailed the hotel and asked if we could have a “nice” double room, and one overlooking Via Cavour, and they graciously gave us a lovely room (bigger than our oversize US master bedroom at home!) with wood floors and high ceilings. So, we’d say your experience here largely depends on the room you stay in – not unlike hotels anywhere. The hotel is located within walking distance of the central train station (Roma Termini) and when we arrived, we took the regional train from the airport to Termini and simply walked to the hotel. We did the same on the way home, and saved tons on taxi fares. The hotel is central enough that we walked to most Rome attractions, and when we needed to go further (e.g. Vatican City) we were able to walk the short distance from the hotel to the Rome Metro for easy access to public transportation. Breakfast was good (a really nice self-serve espresso/cappuccino machine), the staff was courteous and professional and the room was great. We say “Four Stars”.

Reviews.Title: “What's up with the good reviews? This place is a Days Inn at 4-star price”
Reviews.Author: hlau1215
Reviews.Content: On our last day in Italy we stayed at this hotel after traveling through Tuscany. I wanted to pick a nice place close to the train station so that we have easy access to the airport and also good last impression of Rome. Wow, were we disappointed. The room smelled like paint, probably due to recent renovations, and the bed literally felt like a pile of straws. We couldn't get warm water in the shower (it was either freezing cold or scalding hot), and the windows wouldn't close so we slept through street traffic all night. The whole evening my thoughts were "we just have to get through tonight so we can get out of here"... that is not how you'd want to end your vacation. Do not stay here, by any means. If you want value and convenient transportation there are plenty other options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice People - Rip off internet.”
Reviews.Author: Tina&Rob
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat. It is close to the metro and the main train station "Termini". We flew into one airport and out of the other and the location proved hand for all situations. The breakfast is pretty good and is pretty standard continental breakfast fare. The room had really high ceilings but the furniture could use a little updating for a place that claimed to be a 4 star on priceline. I disliked how "slopey" the bottom of the bathtub was and I couldn't stand flat in it without my feet curving up the sides. The bed was relaxing and not too hard after exhausting ourselves walking around the city. Once again, the internet was a ripoff. Too many €'s spent for such a little service that doesn't take much to provide. Why is it that more expensive hotels charge and arm and a leg and cheap hotels provide this for free? It seems so backwards. Also, the walls are thing to the hallway and could hear people talkign when coming back from a night in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good airconditioning in steaming city”
Reviews.Author: islington3164
Reviews.Content: We stayed for an extended weekend in July 2009. The hotel is not in the historic centre of Rome, but it's extremely close to the train station and a one minute walk to the nearest subway station. While the subway is convenient for the Colosseum and Forum, the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Piazza de Popolo and the Trevi Fountain, it's not convenient for sights in the western areas of central Rome, i.e., around Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Campo de Fiori, etc. The nearest "big" tourist attraction is the Colosseum and while it might be a comfortable 15 minute walk in the Fall, Winter or Spring, it was no fun at all in the middle of Summer. As to the hotel itself, we found it very clean and despite the 170+ rooms, discreet and private. Our room was large by Italian standards, the air conditioning worked briliiantly, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was a decent size. Our room faced a side street but close to the busy Via Cavour and we never heard any traffic noises, although at times, you can feel the subway rumble underneath....no big deal. We had plenty of cable channels, but only CNN and BBC News in English and one German channel....everything else was in Italian. There is no internet service in the room, but there's a computer in the lobby that you can use for a fee. We didn't have dinner at the hotel but breakfast was OK. There were two hot dishes...eggs and bacon, plus cheese, one cold meat, cereal, fruit and bread. The coffee was good and strong. What really stood out at this hotel was the friendliness of the staff. I did not find Romans to be very friendly and in fact, curt on many occasions. However, the staff at the hotel was very courteous, helpful and attentive. We got the room through Priceline at $130 a night which I thought was excellent value for a room during Summer in Rome. If you don't mind the subway and walking, I would definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Rome. The

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was the best of the four we stayed in on the tour............”
Reviews.Author: Jayessfla
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, which is somewhat unusual in Italy. Excellent location in the heart of the city. Rooms were good size and the bathroom was bigger than most we experienced on this tour.. Breakfast buffet was just average.....Ask for room facing Via Cavour which is a main street, but still is quiet for sleeping at night.

Reviews.Title: “The Massimo was magic..”
Reviews.Author: gerrygag
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, Old World charm, Bedrooms somewhat small but very hign ceilings gave great sense of space. Well appointed bathroom, Tall elegant windows with olde timber shutters for extra shading as required. Very conveniently located close to main railway station, walking distance to many of Rome's historic attractions, shopping and bus tours of city. Staff helpful, excellent buffet breakfast, comfortable lounge area with nice discreet bar / coffee service available.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Virginia2002
Reviews.Content: The Massimo D'Azelgio was a good hotel & in a good location. We were on a 14 day tour so our tour group made our reservations. My husband & I were able to walk to many of Rome's attractions to include the Pantheon, the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain and the Colisseum - even saw some of the filming of "Angels & Demons" when we exited the Pantheon. We took an extremely long walk our 2nd day and went over to Castel Sant' Angelo. The hotel has free street maps at the front desk which we used in conjunction with a tour book that we had brought with us. Across the main street, the Via Cavour, is another hotel. This hotel has a rooftop terrace with a bar. Just enter the hotel's lobby and take the elevator. It was a wonderful place to spend our last night in Rome, watch the sun go down & enjoy a glass a wine. Our room was on the 2nd floor facing Via Cavour & it was a quiet room. We did not hear the traffic. The hotel served a good buffet breakfast. My only complaint would be that our bed was a bit hard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cvette66
Reviews.Content: This hotel was on the "Ten Day Crown of Italy" Tour we went on with Gate 1. I travel a lot for my job in the states and stay at Hyatts, Hiltons, etc. I was pretty much pleased with this hotel. Ask for a large room when you check in and if they have one free, they'll move you (couples...book twin bed rooms in Italy. They are normally pushed together anyway. King and Queen beds are NOT the size we are used to). We had a large lovely room with a beautiful bathroom, refrigerator, flat screen TV and good air conditioning. My 2 kids received the same type of room. Great location for the trains and buses (be adventurous!), a Conad supermarket in the nearby Termini station where we picked up 6 packs of water for 1.5 Euro, bottles of local good wine for 4 Euro, snacks, etc. Breakfast was pretty good. The hotel was clean, service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Practical Base For Exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: GLYM
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four nights visit in Rome. The hotel provided easy access to both metro and busses, whilst it was not lacking in the areas of cleanliness,staff service, room quality and breakfast. We would definetely recommended for couples who need a base from whch to explore the city of Rome. Of rather minor importance was the small tremure felt when train cars from near by metro station passed by.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very nice, room small”
Reviews.Author: linderman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days at the end of May after spending some time in the countryside of Italy on a driving trip. The hotel is very inconvenient to check into since it has no parking area to pull your car into. There is no bellman standing outside so you need to go in the hotel and leave the car double parked. You can use the internet (for a charge) in the large, nicely decorated lobby. Breakfast in the morning was quite nice although it is over by 10:30 a.m. The room we paid $303 a night for was VERY small. The Termini Station area of Rome was not to my liking. We have been to Rome before and I would not pick this area to stay in if I went back again. Although you can walk to the Collesium from here, about a 10 minute walk. The hotel staff was adequate but not overly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great for exploring city and traveling around”
Reviews.Author: bekaterina
Reviews.Content: Just got back from fantastic trip to Italy organized by Gate1. Rome was our first stop and Massimo D'Azegli became our home for 3 days. Hotel has good location - train and bus stations are 5min walk. Metro stop in 2 min away. This is good for travelers who like to explore on their own. To get to Centro historico you might want to take a metro (7 min ride 1euro one way). Colloseum is in walking distance (30min) Since we were on a tour most of our transportation was taken care of by Gate1 that included tours to all major sights. We had two rooms with city views and parket floors. Rooms are spacious enough bathrooms are not. There is no coffee machine in a room. Hotel service was good - nothing outstanding. Hotel Restaurant offered european style breakfast with cold cuts of meat and cheese, cereal, coffe , desert, fresh fructs and salad. Dinner at the hotel was the best traditional italian food we've had in town (veal was the prima) Overall it meets 4 star category features on all levels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: shel123Lancashire
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, clean & spacious room. Little trouble with the "Key Cards" didn't always work but staff always on hand to fix. Great location to catch buses & tour buses, just a few minutes walk from Metro & mainline station! Staff helpful and friendly. DON'T USE Terravision to & from the airport! RIP OFF, not reliable. Use a shuttle bus, cheaper & reliable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikki439
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, clean, spacious room. Great location to catch buses and tour buses etc! Staff helpful and friendly. Lovely place! Don’t use Terri vision to and from the airport! Rip off, not reliable. Use a shuttle bus, cheaper and reliable!

Reviews.Title: “Hmm! I Will Never Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: karissa2000
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia mainly because it was close to the Termini Station, which is the best way to get to central Rome from the Airport. I had been searching for hotels for weeks, and just gave up and chose this one eventually. Boy, what a mistake. Firstly, the problem with getting to the hotel. After forgetting the address to the hotel, we had to resort to taking a cab, because although I knew the hotel was about a minute away, I had no idea which direction I should have gone. We took the taxi, and to my surprise, after about 45 seconds we arrived at the hotel. The hotel was just on the other side of the road, and about a block down. To my surprise, the taxi driver charged 15 EUROS. Yes! For a 45 second drive, 15 EUROS!! Secondly, the problem with checking in. Since the room was already paid for through Expedia, the room was already paid in full. They hotel front desk said they needed a credit card, as well as a phtocopy of our passports. Now, this is the first time i've ever had a copy of my passport taken, in ANY country, and i;ve travelled alot. Anyway, we gave them the passports and they took the photocopies. JUST ONE PROBLEM!.They gave us our room keys and said that was it. Guess What? They never gave us back our passports. Just before walking off, we realised this and asked where the passports were. To my surprise...the passports were hidden under a stack of paper. I was not impressed. This signalled to me that my time in Rome was not going to be pleasant. The room was OK. Nothing spectacular. The furniture was old, and the toilet seemed like something out of medieval times. The bed linen didnt smell clean, and the pillows were flat. The hotel is located right next to a busy street, so in order to reduce noise, try to always keep the windows closed. There are no clocks, and no iron or ironing board. I even got a towel that had a huge hole in it. The area where the hotel is situated, is one where I would advise not to walk at night. Rome citizens are crafty theives. So be extremely careful. In light of this, we decided to order some food, through room service. We had steak, which cost 50 euros a plate. I ordered the steak and asked for it to be well done. The person who took the order apparently was the 'bartender', and when i asked him what came with the steak, he told me 'i dont kno mam, im just the bartender'. When the steak came, it was anything but well done. A piece of red meat with blood coming out as soon as you cut it. It also came with some spinach that was extremely slimy, and some 'bread' which was hard and stale. (Please see the photos I posted to take a look at the meal). Overall, this hotel is a bad choice. Staying here will make the rest of your stay in Rome unpleasant. The hotel provides free breakfast, but i cant comment on it because i didn;t eat it. It didnt look very appetizing. For a nice dinner, just down the road is a restaurant called Roberto's. They serve 3 course meals for 15 euros which is delicious. Also, a good way of getting around Rome is by the hop on nop off tourist bus. It goes to all the sights and you can get off and get back on wherever, you like. Check Viator.com for tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Noisy room, Watch the elevators”
Reviews.Author: Bruce-Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: We were part of a tour group. Our room did not have an electronic key; It had a skeleton key on a ring! We could hear other people in the rooms on either side of us. In fact, our next door neighbors used our alarm clock to wake them. The elevator stalled at least 4 times in the 3 nights we stayed and people we know we stranded for 10-30 minutes. Breakfast was good. The bar and lobby were very nice. People at the front desk were courteous and helpful. You can walk to most places in Rome from here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bencare
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel for it's location. It is right next to Termini, the main train station and the Metro is only a block away. It is within walking distance of the Colloseum. I had a 1 person room, so the bed was small, but the bathroom was fine. All in all, no complaints. Good value and certainly good location

Reviews.Title: “very happy”
Reviews.Author: sumtinbtr
Reviews.Content: i found this hotel on hotels.com. i have been traveling around europe for a few weeks. for the amount i paid for this hotel i was blown away. the room was large. the bathroom was very big with a full shower/tub, marble everywhere and a bidet. the hotel was very clean and kept very well. the front staff was very helpful and personnable. the location was great. it is on via cavour about 100 meters from tremini station and a 12 minute walk to the coloseum and roman forums. there are also plenty of restaurants around the hotel and shops to pick up souvenires and day to day items. the hotel furnishes you with breakfast and any items that you may have forgotten in your toiletrie bag. i would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but keep a few things in mind”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkEd
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is excellent, the train and bus stops are nearby. (If you go to Rome, buy a bus map on the very first day, this will help you get around Rome). Breakfast in the hotel is very good. We got a nice room, nice size bathroom, we were shock about the size of the bathroom, because according to Rome standards, the bathrooms are usually very small. The disadvantage about this hotel is: the staffs speak very limited English, you can not communicate well with them; In face, it is not a custom to speak English in Rome, be prepared for it, so you will not be disappointed for this. The hotel does not have free Internet access, I repeat -NO- FREE Internet access, I read many reviews before I went to this hotel and they wrote this hotel has free Internet Access, which is NOT true. You have to swipe your credit card in order to access it in the lobby area. Have fun in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice People, But.....”
Reviews.Author: pcsqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel (Room #151) from Monday, 08MAY06 to Saturday, 13MAY06. My husband was attending a conference sponsored by an Italian government ministry, so this was our only hotel option. Note: We typically stay on the Vatican side of the Tiber, in a small, family-run hotel. Positives: 1. Everyone seemed very nice and helpful, especially when things were going wrong (which they did quite often, unfortunately). 2. The room was clean, as was the bathroom. 3. Never ran out of hot water, nor were we scalded or frozen to death when someone in another room flushed the toilet. 4. The room was quiet; but we were in the back, facing an air shaft and office building. I, understand, however, from other conference attendees that street noise was a problem in other rooms. 5. The hotel lobby and bar are non-smoking. 6. The breakfast buffet was extensive and well-stocked. Damning with faint praise, aren't I? Negatives: 1. While the small room was expected (this is Rome), the odd decor wasn't. (Although we were warned in another review.) I must agree that the rooms, although recently painted and nicely faux-finished, were filled with furniture which appeared to come from a hotel garage-sale, circa 1965. 2. Many maintenance problems: a. Bathroom ceiling leaked b. Air conditioning stopped working c. Electricity failed d. Room safe nonfunctional While all were fixed promptly, it became tiresome having to call maintenance just about every day of our stay. 3. A room was not available upon our arrival -- at 1545. We were left to cool our heels in the lobby for 45 minutes while a room was found. 4. Problems with the initial reservation. My husband made the reservation for two persons, in a double, non-smoking room approximately one month before our arrival date. When I called to confirm the reservation, I was told that he was assigned a single room for a day later than the arrival date. While management was able to change the reservation (after I was initially told changes were "impossible"), my husband had to fax his request to the hotel. I suspect that the contract from the Italian Ministry of Defense had something to do with their willingness to change things. 5. This is a tourist hotel, and is not capable (although it claims otherwise) of supporting business functions. My husband, before an impromptu briefing, asked for Xerox copies of a few pages of documents. He was told it was "impossible" and was sent up the street to a tobacco shop. While I fault the organizers of the conference for their selection, a hotel which advertises itself as able to support business affairs should at least be able to make a few copies. 6. There are no "Do Not Disturb" cards in the room. I guess it's because the management wants and expects us tourists to be up and at 'em at oh-dark-thirty, but the lack of cards means that one can expect a maid to knock on one's door sometimes as early as 0730. As a matter of fact, the day we departed, the maid knocked at 0730, 0800, 0815, and 0830. No doubt, management was concerned with not having a repeat of the problem mentioned in paragraph 3. 7. While the neighborhood isn't as bad and I'd been warned about, it wasn't great. Much traffic noise and a steady stream of tourists, business people, and others. (Others being a euphanism for rather seedy-looking characters.) The restaurants in the area were of the Let's-Rip-Off-The-Tourist variety (a report provided by other conference attendees - we ate on the other side of the Tiber). Overall, while the place wasn't horrible, I'd not go back -- either to the hotel or section of town.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient to all tourist destinations in Rome. Being right down the street from the Termini train station, you only need to walk a block to catch the subway or train to the airport or other Italian destination. The Staff was helpful and could speak decent english. I had a room on the back side with a window into the interior square and had no problem with noise. The only negatives were that (i) the room was cold and the thermostat was apparently not working and (ii) the bathroom had a foul odor - although it looked immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel in 1998, at the recommendation of an Italian cousin of mine. The hotel had an excellent restaurant then, and a great staff, but age had caught up a bit on the hotel furnishings. Things have gotten better and better since then. We just love this place. When we were there in August, the staff was INCREDIBLY helpful to us. The restaurant was marvelous, too. We had a superb corner room, with spectacular windows, overlooking Cavour. Hey, this is a world class mega-city, so you can't expect total silence at night. And, what an incredible final bit of help. We had quite a lot of luggage with us, and were going to the Termini to catch a train to Firenze. I suggested to the bell captain that maybe we'd need a cab, even though we were so close to the train. Well, he said, "Don't be concerned, we'll help you." He had a bellman load a luggage cart with all our luggage, and then he had the bellman accompany us across the two streets we had to cross and right into the Termini. Needless to say, I tipped him accordingly. The point is, these folks are boundless in their willingness to help you. When in Rome, I stay at this hotel. I can't tell you enough good things about it. Rick

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: iandel
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here at the beginning of September and were more than happy. Our room was large, clean & had a nice character to it - the bathroom was excellent. The best thing though is the location - it's around 200 metres from Stazione Termini, where there are buses and the metro to connect you with the rest of the city & airports. The area didn't seem overly rough to me & in any case Via Cavour is a very busy street, so it's unlikely anything is going to happen to you. Just use common-sense. There are restaurants around the hotel, but I would recommend getting the H bus from the terminal to Trastevere - get off as soon as you cross the river & turn right - there are a bunch of really nice, cheap restaurants situated in attractive little squares. For those that want to go boozing, the best pub we found was the Druids Rock off Via Cavour, opposite Santa Maria Maggiore.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: PuffinMarine
Reviews.Content: Good location, large clean rooms, good breakfast. Staff a little surly and overall not an especially pleasant experience. Brits will perhaps be disappointed at the absence of BBC World News - CNN is all you get. I'd stay there again, but the train out to the Airport is worth avoiding if you can afford a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: alanmc
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried about this hotel after reading the reviews but was pleasantly surprised. Room and bath were spacious (for Italy). Hotel was a good base location -- most tourist sites were about a 6 -8 euro taxi ride away or could catch an on/off sight seeing tour at the train station. Single bed was comfortable even for my 6'5" frame although I couldn't entirely stretch out. I thought the surrounding area was completely safe. Visited the rooftop bar at the sister hotel across the street-- very nice! Don't plan on pressing any clothes in your room -- not allowed. Bring your own travel clock-- both hotels in Italy where I stayed didn't have alarm clocks.

Reviews.Title: “Long Stay”
Reviews.Author: technics1210uk
Reviews.Content: I'm just coming to an end of what will be a 5 month stay at this Hotel, working in Rome. I've read through some of the reviews and some I find quite unfair, OK the rooms adjacent to the surrounding rounds can be noisy and sometimes you do feel like Michael Flatterly is doing a river dance in the room above but this hotel is over 120 years old, built long before buses and coaches rumbled up and down via Cavour and when wooden flooring was all the rage. They have tried as best they can to eliminate noise but I feel that if they did anymore then the beauty and character of the hotel would diminish. Rooms can be small but as I overheard one American tour guide explain to her party "Each room is different, some big some small". The best advice I can offer would be to try and get a room on the top floor on the innerside of the building but if noise isn't a problem then I'd go for a room alongside via Cavour, lots of things happen along this road such and it's nice to people watch out of the MASSIVE windows. Firstly I must say that I think the Hotel is a bit understaffed but having said that the staff that they have are wonderful, friendly and extremely hard working, the latter being something very rare in Rome as anybody who has spent enough time here will know only too well !!!! The bar is very nicely decorated and well stocked. Giuliano & Angellino are a couple of cheeky chappies who'll look after you at the bar, they are very friendly, always willing to chat. During the Summer months residents are encouraged to go over the road to the sister hotel "The Meditterano" and make use of their 10th floor roof garden, it's the highest panoramic viewing point in the whole of Rome and simply a beautiful place to relax and have drinks in the evening. The food in the Restaurant is some of, if not the best I have had in Rome (certainly in the area) as is the (silver) service. They have an a la Carte menu as well as a daily menu, and they use the freshed and best ingredients. It's maybe a little bit more pricier than some of the surrounding eateries it is certainly excellent value for money. Plenty of class. Yes the Breakfast is basic but that is the same for any other Hotel that I have spent time in during my stay in Rome, also when the Hotel is full the staff in the breakfast rooms seem to be rushed off their feet and you may need to wait a while why a table is cleared for you, not too much a hardship I think. The location is brilliant, right by Termini Station and all sights are very easily to get to. The area however is a bit grotty, like most of Rome there is Graffiti all over the place and not even good Graffiti, if there is such a thing, for a city so rich in art and culture you'd expect a bit to rub off on the vandals. Should I ever return to Rome on business or pleasure would I stay here? Absolutely, without question. Feel free to email me if you require anymore information, I can point you in the right direction for some nice restaurants, wine bars and pubs. Last piece of advice for anybody travelling to Rome - Only get in a Taxi that has the red "Commue di Roma" sticker on the outside, these are governed Taxi's, the name of the driver and the number of the taxi should be on a small plaque on the inside of the passenger doors, you should also find some information in the taxi detailing the payment structure, once inside the GIR (Roman Ring Road) the tariff should always be on option 1, let the driver know that you are aware of this and save yourself plenty of Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Uhhhh”
Reviews.Author: sannasun
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 1 day stay at Massimo D'Azeglio. LOCATION: Its a basic hotel close to Stazione Termini. Two metro lines meet at Termini providing easy access to tourist sights from the hotel. ROOM: I stayed in a single room. It was just basic with very little storage space in the room and bathroom. The room was very small even to European standards and bathroom was worse. The bed and sheets have a worn look and were terrible. STAFF: I didn't have enough opportunity to form an opinion about the staff. They seemed friendly at check-in and check-out. FACILITIES: The hotel provided computer has free high speed internet access in the lobby. The rooms does NOT have WiFi (high speed wireless internet) access. There was a lousy ancient TV in the room. Noticeably missing was BBC from the channel lineup. To SUM UP, I'd rate the hotel as 2 star per U.S. standards. The hotel location and price made me reserve there. It was Easter weekend and I couldn't find any cheaper hotel with available room. I'd definitely stay away from Massimo D'Azeglio next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “too noisy, too expensive for the quality”
Reviews.Author: oakleafgal
Reviews.Content: This is a bus-tour, group hotel. Our room, 104, was street-side and very noisy all through the night. Breakfast was depleted and not refreshed and understaffed. Reception Staff very brusque, uninterested in helping. The hotel is very dated. Beds very hard. Good location. Internet access to them means one computer terminal available free in the lobby (good luck getting time online...the bus tours of teenagers were always occupying the computer). Wireless internet access to them means sit in the lobby near the bar where the transmitter is and pay to access via your own laptop. This is not a good value for us, even with excellent location near central terminal. Next time we'll choose a smaller hotel in an off-street location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a great location. Within walking distance to most sites and within 100 yards of the metro station. Rooms were very clean and had double doors to reduce the noise (could not even hear) of people going down the hall. The staff was very helpful and provided good advice on getting to the different site seeing areas of town. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Poor facilities”
Reviews.Author: jpoon99
Reviews.Content: Location: good, 1 min. walk to Termini Station Air-cond.: not working at all Breakfast: not satisfying enough Room: no coffee/tea, small bed, no slipper, size OK Service: charge 2 Euro for hot water Internet: free use but no Word or Excel Overall: worth 2.5 stars only
